NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to mental health, amends Sections 15-16-41, 15-16-43, 15-16-67, 22-52-1.1, 22-52-10.2, 22-52-10.4, and 22-52-91, Code of Alabama 1975, provides definitions, provides further for the assessment of an individual's threat of harm for purposes of an involuntary commitment hearing, allows a law enforcement officer under certain conditions to deliver an individual to a designated mental health facility for evaluation.

NCSL_TOPICS: Employment and Labor, Data and Transparency
NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to law enforcement, requires the State Peace Officers' Standards and Training Commission to create a database of certain information relating to law enforcement officers, provides that information in the database is confidential, provides for criminal penalties for unauthorized disclosure, requires former law enforcement employers to disclose information to another law enforcement agency for purposes of employment of law enforcement officers, provides immunity for certain disclosures.

Relates to municipalities, provides that a municipality may authorize a law enforcement officer to issue a summons and complaint in lieu of custodial arrest for certain criminal offenses, relates to expenditure of local funds.
Requires the Department of Public Safety to publish certain policies and procedures on the departments Internet website.

NCSL_TITLE: Village Public Safety Officers Background Investigation
NCSL_SUMMARY: Requires background investigations of village public safety officer applicants by the Department of Public Safety, relates to the village public safety officer program.

NCSL_TOPICS: Employment and Labor, Investigations and Discipline
NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to disciplinary appeals, relates to final disposition reporting, relates to law enforcement officers.
Relates to law enforcement officers, relates to polygraph, relates to examinations.

NCSL_TOPICS: Employment and Labor, Investigations and Discipline
NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to public safety officers, relates to preemption.

Provides that it is unlawful for a person to knowingly make a video recording of law enforcement activity if the person making the recording does not have the permission of a law enforcement officer and is within a specified number of feet of where the law enforcement activity is occurring, provides that if such activity is occurring in an enclose structure that is on private property, a person who is authorized to be on the property may make a video recording from an adjacent room or area as specified.
Relates to law enforcement, relates to misconduct investigations, relates to extension.

NCSL_TITLE: Arizona Peace Officer Standards and Training Board
NCSL_SUMMARY: Provides that any findings or recommendations from any government committee, board, agency, department, office or entity shall require a majority vote to investigate law enforcement officer misconduct, influence the conduct of or certify law enforcement officer misconduct investigations, recommend disciplinary actions for law enforcement officer misconduct, and/or impose discipline for law enforcement officer misconduct.

NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to use of force, reports, analysis.
NOTES: use of force, transparency, oversight, accountability

NCSL_TOPICS: Investigations and Discipline, Other Issues, Data and Transparency
NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to law enforcement officers, relates to database, relates to rules.
Relates to civilian review board members, relates to training.
Relates to complaints against peace officers, relates to notification.
Relates to peace officers, relates to investigator membership requirements.

Appropriates monies, relates to criminal justice budget reconciliation, coordinates reentry planning services programs, provides for cross-system recidivism tracking database, establishes a planning committee.
Amends the law concerning the use of audio media, visual media, and audiovisual media by law enforcement agencies, dispatch centers, public safety answering points, jails, and detention centers.

Concerns qualified immunity, includes that law enforcement agencies for and certified law enforcement officers employed by a public or private institution of higher education shall be immune from liability and from suit for damages except to the extent that they may be covered by liability insurance.

NCSL_TITLE: Law Enforcement Agency Organization and Staffing
NCSL_TOPICS: Employment and Labor, Use of Force, Data and Transparency
NCSL_SUMMARY: Concerns law enforcement agency organization, staffing, and personnel matters.
Permits a law enforcement officer to transport a person in crisis to a sobering center.
Concerns critical incident debriefing for law enforcement officers.

Relates to Arkansas Phoenix Act of 2021, concerns the statute of limitations for certain offenses, concerns the training given to law enforcement officers for situations in which domestic violence is suspected.
Concerns the offense of aggravated assault upon a law enforcement officer or an employee of a correctional facility, declares an emergency.

NCSL_TITLE: Law Enforcement Duty to Intervene Training
NCSL_SUMMARY: Requires training concerning a law enforcement officer's duty to intervene when the law enforcement officer observes the use of excessive force by another law enforcement office.

NCSL_TITLE: Behavioral Health Crisis Intervention Protocol Act
NCSL_SUMMARY: Amends the Behavioral Health Crisis Intervention Protocol Act of 2017.

Establishes the Flexible Assistance for Survivors (FAS) pilot grant program, to be administered by the Office of Emergency Services. Requires the office to establish a grant selection advisory committee to provide grants to qualifying community-based organizations to establish assistance funds to distribute in direct cash assistance to survivors, as defined. Requires the committee when considering grant applications to give preferences to certain organizations.
NOTES: use of force, transparency, oversight, accountability

NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to law that requires that a candidate for a peace officer position be of good moral character, as determined by a thorough background investigation. Requires that background investigation to include an inquiry into whether a candidate for specified peace officer positions has engaged in membership in a hate group, participation in any hate group activity, or advocacy of public expressions of hate, as specified, and as those terms are defined.

Provides that this bill would, upon appropriation by the Legislature, create the Advisory Council on Improving Interactions between People with Intellectual and Development Disabilities and Law Enforcement, under the Department of Justice, to, among other things, evaluate existing training for peace officers specific to interactions between law enforcement and individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities.

Relates to the Commission on Peace Officer Standards, which requires peace officers in this state to meet specified minimum standards. Provides that those standards shall be interpreted and applied consistent with federal law and regulations, as specified.

NCSL_TITLE: Law Enforcement Agency Policies: Carrying of Equipment
NCSL_SUMMARY: Requires a law enforcement agency that authorizes peace officers to carry an electroshock device, such as a taser or stun gun that is held and operated in a manner similar to a pistol, to require that device to be holstered or otherwise carried on the lateral side of the body opposite to the side that that officer's primary firearm is holstered.

NCSL_TITLE: Peace Officers: Minimum Standards: Bias Evaluation
NCSL_SUMMARY: Requires certain evaluation of peace officers to include bias against race or ethnicity, gender, nationality, religion, disability, or sexual orientation. Revises the accreditation standards for certain institutions relating to minimum education requirements for peace officers, to include an organization holding full membership in Cognia.

NCSL_TITLE: Deaths While In Law Enforcement Custody: Reporting
NCSL_SUMMARY: Provides that if a death occurs while a person is in custody, this bill would require the agency with jurisdiction over the state or local correctional facility with custodial responsibility for the person to post specified information. Grants an agency an additional 10 days to make good faith efforts to notify next of kin if the agency seeks to notify the next of kin and is unable to do so within 10 days of the death.
Requires each state and local agency to include in its annual report with data on all stops conducted by the agency's peace officers the reason given to the person stopped at the time of the stop.

Eliminates certain immunity provisions for peace officers and custodial officers, or public entities employing peace officers or custodial officers sued under the Tom Bane Civil Rights Act. Prohibits a person who has been convicted of a felony, as specified, from regaining eligibility for peace officer employment based upon any later order of the court setting aside, vacating, withdrawing, expunging or otherwise dismissing or reversing the conviction, unless the court finds the person to be innocent.

NCSL_TOPICS: Employment and Labor, Oversight, Use of Force, Data and Transparency, Standards
NCSL_SUMMARY: Makes a sustained finding involving force that is unreasonable or excessive, and any sustained finding that an officer failed to intervene against another officer using unreasonable or excessive force, subject to disclosure. Requires records relating to sustained findings of unlawful arrests and unlawful searches to be subject to disclosure.
NOTES: transparency, oversight, accountability, use of force

NCSL_SUMMARY: Requires law enforcement use-of-force policies to require peace officers to immediately report potential excessive force. Requires those policies to, among other things, prohibit retaliation against officers that report violations of law or regulation of another officer to a supervisor, and requires that an officer who fails to intercede be disciplined up to and including in the same manner as the officer who used excessive force.
NOTES: transparency, oversight, accountability, use of force

NCSL_SUMMARY: Prohibits the use of kinetic energy projectiles or chemical agents by any law enforcement agency to disperse any assembly, protest, or demonstration, except in compliance with specified standards. Prohibits their use solely due to a violation of an imposed curfew, verbal threat, or noncompliance with a law enforcement directive. Provides that use of such weapons can only be used to defend against a threat to life or serious bodily injury or to bring control to an objectively dangerous situations.

Requires the office of the Chancellor of the California Community Colleges to develop a modern policing degree program, with the commission and other stakeholders to serve as advisors, as specified, and to submit a report on recommendations to the Legislature outlining a plan to implement the program on or before specified date.

NCSL_TITLE: Arrest Warrants: Declaration of Probable Cause
NCSL_SUMMARY: Requires a magistrate, before issuing an arrest warrant, to examine the declaration of probable cause made by a peace officer, or an employee of a public prosecutor's office when the subject of the arrest warrant is a peace officer.
Grants peace officer status to security officers appointed by the Exposition Park Manager, as specified, and clarifies the training requirements for those peace officers.

NCSL_TITLE: Law Enforcement Policies: Arrests: Positional Asphyxia
NCSL_SUMMARY: Prohibits a law enforcement agency from authorizing techniques or transport methods that involve a substantial risk of positional asphyxia, as defined.

States that whether a particular factual or legal determination in a prior appeal proceeding has preclusive effect in proceedings of the commission would be governed by the existing law of collateral estoppel.

Authorizes the state prosecutor to investigate and gather facts in an incident involving a shooting by a peace officer that results in the death of an unarmed civilian. Authorizes the state prosecutor to investigate and gather facts in an incident involving a shooting by a peace officer that results in the death of a civilian if there is a reasonable dispute as to whether the civilian was armed.

Makes it a crime for a peace officer to make a false statement to another peace officer if that statement is included in a peace officer report. Clarifies that the exemption for third party statements does not apply to the peace officer writing or making the report, with regard to a false statement that the peace officer included in the report that is attributed to any other person, if the peace officer knows the statement is false and is including the statement to present the statement as being true.

NCSL_TITLE: Peace Officers and Law Enforcement Gangs
NCSL_SUMMARY: Defines a law enforcement gang as a group of law enforcement officers within an agency that engages in a pattern of specified unlawful or unethical on-duty behavior. Requires law enforcement agencies to have a policy prohibiting law enforcement gangs and making participation in a law enforcement gang grounds for termination. Requires an agency to disclose an officer's termination for involvement in a law enforcement gang to another law enforcement agency conducting a preemployment background check.

NCSL_TITLE: Sexual Assault by Law Enforcement Officers: Limitations
NCSL_SUMMARY: Exempts a claim arising out of an alleged sexual assault, as defined, by a law enforcement officer if the alleged assault occurred on or after the plaintiff's 18th birthday and while the officer was employed by a law enforcement agency from all state and local government claim presentation requirements.

Prohibits a police department or sheriff's office from sharing, on social media, booking photos of an individual arrested on suspicion of committing a nonviolent crime, unless specified circumstances exist. Requires a police department or sheriff's office that shares, on social media, a booking photo of an individual arrested for the suspected commission of any crime to remove the information from its social media page, upon request, unless the same specified circumstances exist.
Prohibits, with certain exceptions, a law enforcement agency from authorizing or allowing its employees to wear a uniform that is substantially similar to a uniform of the United States Armed Forces.

Requires the evaluation of peace officers by a physician and surgeon, or psychologist, to include bias against race or ethnicity, gender, nationality, religion, disability, or sexual orientation. Requires every department or agency that employs peace officers to review the job descriptions used in the recruitment and hiring of those peace officers and to make changes that deemphasize the paramilitary aspects of the job and place more emphasis on community interaction and collaborative problem solving.

NCSL_TITLE: County Board Of Supervisors: Sheriff Oversight
NCSL_SUMMARY: Authorizes a county to establish a Sheriff Oversight Board to assist the Board of Supervisors with those duties as they relate to the Sheriff, either by action of the Board of Supervisors or through a vote of county residents. Authorizes the Chair of the Oversight Board and the Inspector General to issue a subpoena or subpoena duces tecum when deemed necessary to investigate a matter within their jurisdiction.
Prohibits a law enforcement agency from authorizing the use of a carotid restraint or a choke hold.

Requires a state prosecutor to investigate incidents of an officer involved shooting resulting in the death of an unarmed civilian. Makes the Attorney General the state prosecutor unless otherwise specified or named. Authorizes the state prosecutor to prepare a written report and to post any reports made on a public internet website. Requires the Attorney General to operate a Police Practices Division to review the use of deadly force policies of a requesting law enforcement agency.

Provides that a person shall not assume or exercise the functions, powers, duties, or privileges incident and belonging a marshal, police officer, or other peace officer without having first received an appointment in writing from the lawfully constituted authorities of the state.

NCSL_TITLE: Policies For Peace Officer Credibility Disclosures
NCSL_SUMMARY: Concerns adoption of written policies by law enforcement agencies for constitutionally required peace officer credibility disclosure notifications.

NCSL_TITLE: Peace Officers Mental Health Grant Program
NCSL_TOPICS: Policing Alternatives and Collaboration, Officer Safety and Wellbeing
NCSL_SUMMARY: Concerns expanding the peace officers behavioral health support grant program to include community partnerships, makes an appropriation.
Concerns secure transportation for an individual in behavioral health crisis, makes an appropriation.

NCSL_TITLE: First Responder Interactions Persons With Disabilities
NCSL_SUMMARY: Concerns establishing a commission to improve first responder interactions with persons with disabilities, makes an appropriation.

NCSL_TITLE: Measures to Address Law Enforcement Accountability
NCSL_TOPICS: Employment and Labor, Investigations and Discipline, Use of Force, Data and Transparency, Decertification, Standards
NCSL_SUMMARY: Concerns measures to address law enforcement accountability, makes an appropriation.

NCSL_TOPICS: Training, Certification, Other Issues, Oversight, Technology, Use of Force
NCSL_SUMMARY: Concerns measures to enhance law enforcement integrity, makes an appropriation.

NCSL_TITLE: Accreditation Standards for Law Enforcement Units
NCSL_SUMMARY: Concerns accreditation standards for law enforcement units.

Concerns the timely reporting by the police of a death, provides that whenever a person who is a next of kin of a deceased person is not notified of such deceased persons death and no other person who is a next of kin of the deceased person was so notified, and requests of the Office of the Inspector General an investigation of the lack of notification or timely notification of such death, the Inspector General shall investigate and determine whether there was any malfeasance.

Concerns periodic behavioral health assessments, police officer recruitment, school resource officers, reporting of violations to the police officer standards and training council, investigations by the inspector general, minimum standards and practices for the administration, management and operation of law enforcement units and the correction advisory committee.

NCSL_TITLE: Mental Health Needs of and Services for Police Officers
NCSL_TOPICS: Training, Employment and Labor, Officer Safety and Wellbeing
NCSL_SUMMARY: Provides that no law enforcement unit shall discharge, discipline, discriminate against or penalize a police officer who is employed by such law enforcement unit solely because the police officer seeks or receives mental health care services, including such services as a result of a behavioral health assessment.
Concerns the process of appointments, reviews and evaluations by the Criminal Justice Commission, Division of Criminal Justice and the Office of the Inspector General.
Concerns the use of opioid antagonists by police officers and studying the use of epinephrine cartridge injectors by police officers.

Concerning civilian police review boards, security guards, body-worn recording equipment and searches by police, provides that the person to whom such subpoena is issued may, not later than fifteen days after service of such subpoena, or on or before the time specified in the subpoena for compliance if such time is less than fifteen days after service.

NCSL_TITLE: Use of Force By a Peace Officer
NCSL_SUMMARY: Concerns use of force by a peace officer, provides that the peace officer reasonably determined that there are no available reasonable alternatives to the use of deadly physical force.

NCSL_TOPICS: Training, Other Issues, Oversight, Technology, Use of Force
NCSL_SUMMARY: Concerns police accountability

NCSL_TOPICS: Investigations and Discipline, Data and Transparency, Decertification
NCSL_SUMMARY: Directs the Criminal Justice Council to establish and by November 2, 2021, publish integrity reports on the number of complaints made against police officers in each police agency in this state for the past 3 years, and at least once a year thereafter, and to create and publish a list of all decertified police officers in this state in the previous 10 years, which shall be updated upon notification of the decertification of any police officer.

Codifies a reasonableness requirement for the use of force, both non-lethal and lethal, relates to the state of mind in a criminal trial, relates to defendant believes, makes clear that deadly force includes the use of a chokehold.

NCSL_TITLE: Division Of Civil Rights and Public Trust
NCSL_TOPICS: Investigations and Discipline, Use of Force, Data and Transparency
NCSL_SUMMARY: Expands the Division of Civil Rights and Public Trust's responsibility to review deadly use of force incidents by law enforcement by adding review of cases involving serious physical injury, requires that if the Division issues a public report on the use of force, the report must include the race of the law enforcement officer who used force, the race of the individual on whom force was used, and whether race was a relevant or motivating factor.

Requires certain police officers and some certain employees of the Department of Correction and Department of Services for Children, Youth, and Their Families to wear a body worn camera and to use the body worn camera to record interactions with a member of the public in accordance with the regulations to be established by the Council on Police Training, requires state agencies to implement the statewide body worn camera program through the procurement of cameras, development of a central data storage.

Relates to the Uniform Electronic Recordation of Custodial Interrogations Act, relates to the electronic recording requirement, provides that a law enforcement officer conducting a custodial interrogation is not required to obtain consent to electronic recording from the individual being interrogated or to inform the individual that an electronic recording is being made of the interrogation.

Creates the crime of aggravated strangulation, relates to a person being guilty of aggravated strangulation, if the person is a law enforcement officer, and while acting within the person's official capacity as a law enforcement officer, knowingly or intentionally uses a chokehold on another person.

NCSL_TOPICS: Training, Oversight, Data and Transparency, Standards
NCSL_SUMMARY: (Temporary Act) Provides, on a temporary basis, for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors, and for other purposes.
NOTES: training, use of force, oversight, body camera

NCSL_SUMMARY: Amends the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Second Temporary Amendment Act, extends the report submission and sunset dates of the Police Reform Commission.
Provides, on an emergency basis, for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors, and for other purposes.

NCSL_TOPICS: Training, Oversight, Use of Force, Standards
NCSL_SUMMARY: Provides, on a temporary basis, for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors, and for other purposes.

NCSL_TOPICS: Training, Oversight, Use of Force, Standards
NCSL_SUMMARY: (Emergency Act) Relates to Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2021, improves police accountability and transparency, prohibits the use of neck restraints, improves access to body-worn camera video recordings, relates to office of police complaints reforms.

NCSL_TOPICS: Training, Other Issues, Oversight, Technology, Use of Force, Standards
NCSL_SUMMARY: (Enrolled) Provides, on an emergency basis, for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors, and for other purposes.

NCSL_SUMMARY: Provides, due to congressional review, for comprehensive policing and justice reform for District residents and visitors.

Amends, on an emergency basis, the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Second Temporary Amendment Act of 2020 to extend the report submission and sunset dates of the Police Reform Commission, amends the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2020 to make conforming changes.

NCSL_TITLE: Records of Physical Examinations of Officers
NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to officer and firefighter physical examination requirements and records, authorizes the use of a specified physical examination for a presumption, requires a fire service provider to maintain records of employee physical examinations for a specified period, creates a presumption if records are destroyed before such period has elapsed, requires an employing agency to maintain records of employee physical examinations for a specified period.

Relates to public records/law enforcement geolocation information, defines the term law enforcement geolocation information, provides an exemption from public records requirements for law enforcement geolocation information held by a law enforcement agency, provides for future legislative review and repeal of the exemption, provides a statement of public necessity.

Prohibits the unauthorized use or release of any information contained in the Driver and Vehicle Information Database, provides for noncriminal infraction, requires the law enforcement accreditation program to address access to and use of personal identification information contained in electronic databases, requires the Criminal Justice Standards and Training Commission to incorporate into the course curriculum instruction on the authorized access to and use of personal identification information.

NCSL_TITLE: Law Enforcement and Correctional Officer Practices
NCSL_TOPICS: Training, Investigations and Discipline, Use of Force, Data and Transparency, Standards
NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to law enforcement and correctional officer practices, requires application for employment or appointment as law enforcement or correctional officer to contain specified disclosures, requires background investigation of applicant to include specified information, requires employing agencies to maintain employment information for minimum period, requires establishment of standards for officer training and policies concerning use of force.
NOTES: use of force, transparency, oversight, accountability

NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to the Georgia Behavioral Health and Peace Officer Co Responder Act, provides for immunity for the transport of a patient to a facility, provides for the establishment of co responder programs, provides for co responder teams composed of peace officers and behavioral health professionals, provides for training of co responder team members, provides for dispatch of co responder teams, provides for co responder protocol committees, provides for support services.
NOTES: qualified immunity, tactics, mental health diversion

NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to motor vehicles and traffic, so as to provide for vehicles operated by certain law enforcement to be equipped with flashing or revolving lights which are primarily blue in color, removes a restriction relating to motor vehicles of the Georgia State Patrol.

Relates to criminal procedure, revises certain arrest powers, provides for arrests by a law enforcement officer outside their law enforcement agency's jurisdiction under certain circumstances, revises the grounds for arrest by a private person, provides for the detaining of certain persons reasonably suspected of having committed certain crimes under certain circumstances, relates to operators of private detective businesses and private security businesses, relates to detention related to shoplifting.

NCSL_TITLE: Office of Public Safety Officer Support
NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to privileged communications between law enforcement officers, peer counselors, and the Office of Public Safety Officer Support, changes the name of the Office of Public Safety Officer Support, relates to employment and training of peace officers, enacts a bill of rights for peace officers under investigation, provides for interrogation procedures, provides for the right of notice of disciplinary action, provides for bias motivated by intimidation against first responders.

NCSL_TOPICS: Certification, Oversight, Use of Force, Decertification, Standards
NCSL_SUMMARY: Requires the Chief of Police of each county police department to disclose to the Legislature the identity of a police officer upon suspension or discharge of the officer, amends the Uniform Information Practices Act to allow for the disclosure of information related to the suspension or discharge of a police officer, empowers the Law Enforcement Standards Board to establish uniform statewide standards for law enforcement and the use of force.

NCSL_TITLE: Peace Officer Standards and Training Council
NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to law enforcement, provides for law enforcement training, powers, and duties regarding sexual assault complaints and to make technical corrections, declares an emergency.

NCSL_TITLE: First Responders Peer Support Counseling Disclosures
NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to evidence, defines terms, to prohibit disclosure of certain communications, to provide exceptions, to provide that certain disclosures are subject to the rules of the idaho supreme court, and to make technical corrections, declares an emergency.

Provides that a law enforcement agency or an officer employed by a law enforcement agency may not knowingly and intentionally conduct a background check of a person for the sole reason of that person speaking at an open meeting of a public body, including police disciplinary boards, provides exceptions, provides for a penalty.

NCSL_TOPICS: Training, Oversight, Use of Force, Standards
NCSL_SUMMARY: Amends various acts to revise statutory law to conform the statutes to the reorganization of the executive branch taking effect under Executive Order 2019-12, makes other changes concerning the state police and makes technical and stylistic changes.

NCSL_TITLE: Juvenile Court Act and Criminal Procedure of 1963
NCSL_SUMMARY: Amends the Juvenile Court Act and the Code of Criminal Procedure of 1963, provides that an oral, written, or sign language statement of a minor, who at the time of the commission of the offense was under 18 years of age, made as a result of a custodial interrogation conducted at a police station or other place of detention on or after the effective date of the amendatory Act shall be presumed to be inadmissible as evidence in a criminal proceeding or a juvenile court proceeding.

Amends the State Police Act relating to the military equipment surplus program, defines grenade launcher and tracked armored vehicle, relates to police officer training, provides that all law enforcement agencies must employ the use of officer worn body cameras whether or not the agency receives or has received monies from the Law Enforcement Camera Grant Fund, except court security officers, State's Attorney investigators, and Attorney General investigators, provides for pregnant prisoners.

NCSL_TOPICS: Certification, Employment and Labor, Use of Force, Standards
NCSL_SUMMARY: Establishes a program of mandatory training for law enforcement officers, provides for the establishment of a consistent and uniform statewide deadly force policy and training program and defensive tactics policy and training program, as well as minimum standards regarding other law enforcement training, encourages all law enforcement officers, departments, and agencies within this state to adopt standards, however, any any policy or program created or implemented may not be modified or altered in any way.

NCSL_TITLE: Law Enforcement Officer De Escalation Training
NCSL_TOPICS: Training, Certification, Technology, Use of Force, Decertification, Standards
NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to law enforcement officers, requires the Indiana law enforcement training board to establish mandatory training in de-escalation as part of the use-of-force curriculum, requires de-escalation training to be provided as a part of pre-basic training, mandatory inservice training, and the executive training program, establishes a procedure to allow the Indiana law enforcement training board to decertify an officer who has committed misconduct, defines chokehold, prohibits the use of a chokehold.
Relates to a peace officer's search of garbage placed outside of a person's residence for waste collection in a publicly accessible area.

NCSL_TOPICS: Training, Certification, Oversight, Use of Force, Decertification
NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to peace officers, including the certification, training, prosecution of peace officers, and the use of chokeholds by peace officers.

Relates to any criminal offense committed in another state that would, if committed in this state, constitute a misdemeanor under KRS 510.120, 510.130, or 510.140, a second or subsequent offense under KRS 510.148, or a criminal attempt, conspiracy, facilitation, or solicitation to commit any degree of rape, sodomy, sexual abuse, or sexual misconduct.

NCSL_TOPICS: Employment and Labor, Investigations and Discipline
NCSL_SUMMARY: Removes the requirement that a candidate for employment shall not have passed his or her 46th birthday, amends the definition of member as used in KRS 95.440 to 95.629, provides that the number of police officers a city may hire is based on the total number of officers employed by the city in the immediately preceding year, provides that any person may file a complaint and a mayor, city manager, or legislative body may prefer charges.

Creates procedures and requirements for issuance of warrants authorizing entry without notice, requires judges to review applications for warrants impartially, requires service by SWAT or special response teams with special training, makes clear that an officer's false statement in an application for a warrant authorizing entry without notice constitutes perjury, proposes a rule of evidence making inadmissible any evidence collected as the result of a warrant authorizing entry without notice.

Amend KRS 510.060, rape in the third degree, to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to sexual intercourse, amends KRS 510.090, sodomy in the third degree, to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to deviate sexual intercourse, amends KRS 510.120, sexual abuse in the second degree, to include a peace officer who subjects a person in custody or under arrest to sexual contact.

NCSL_TOPICS: Investigations and Discipline, Use of Force, Decertification
NCSL_SUMMARY: Amends KRS 15.391 to amend the definition of professional malfeasance and professional nonfeasance, adds grounds for the revocation of peace officer certification, provides that the council may impose any reasonable condition upon the reinstatement of certification and provide subpoena power to the council, amends KRS 15.392 to remove reference to KRS 15.386.
Excludes from the Open Records Act photographs or videos that depict a person's death, killing, rape, or sexual assault or abuse, cites as the Bailey Holt-Preston Cope Victims Privacy Act.

Relates to Peace Officer Standards and Training Council certification revocation, provides for malfeasance in office by public officers and employees, provides for a revocation hearing to determine whether a peace officers P.O.S.T. certification will be revoked.

Provides relative to law enforcement records, relates to any document that an agency provides to any defendant after prosecution of an offense has been initiated shall, upon request from the victim or a designated family member.

Provides that no police employee shall be discharged, demoted, suspended, threatened, harassed, or discriminated against in any manner in the terms and conditions of his employment because of any lawful act engaged in by the employee or on behalf of the employee in furtherance of any action taken to report malfeasance in office by police employees to law enforcement, whether such fellow employee is a co worker, supervisor or subordinate, provides for whistleblower protection.

NCSL_TOPICS: Training, Other Issues, Technology, Use of Force, Standards
NCSL_SUMMARY: Provides for responsibilities of law enforcement officers while interacting with the public, provides for body-worn cameras, provides for motor vehicle dash cameras, restricts use of neck restraints, restricts the use of no-knock warrants.
Provides for the Peace Officer and Public Safety Personnel Peer Support and Mental Health Wellness Act.

NCSL_TOPICS: Training, Certification, Employment and Labor, Investigations and Discipline, Use of Force, Decertification
NCSL_SUMMARY: Provides relative to peace officers.

Relates to the arrest of persons with minor or dependent children, provides for the establishment of guidelines and training for law enforcement officers regarding the arrest of persons with minor or dependent children, requires the Council on Peace Officer Standards and Training to develop the guidelines and training in conjunction with certain organizations, provides for certain requirements of law enforcement officers upon arrest of a person.

Relates to time periods for officer disciplinary matters, provides for time limits relative to officer representation, provides for time limits relative to length of investigation of an officer, provides for time limits relative to officer personnel files, provides for related matters.
Provides for situations where peace officers may issue written summons instead of making custodial arrests, relates to officer discretion to make an arrest under certain circumstances.

NCSL_TITLE: Disciplinary Authority of the Board of Trustees
NCSL_SUMMARY: Expands the disciplinary authority of the Board of Trustees of the Maine Criminal Justice Academy, provides for standards of conduct, provides that all complaints, charges or accusations of misconduct, their replies, and any other information or materials that may result in suspension or revocation of a certificate that are considered by the board are confidential, provides that any action taken by the board as a result of a complaint, charge or accusation must be supported by a statement of findings.

NCSL_TITLE: Records of the Employment of Law Enforcement Officers
NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to records of the employment of law enforcement officers and corrections officers, relates to application for employment with a law enforcement agency, correctional facility or county or regional jail, provides that the applicant shall sign a request that an employing agency release all employment records to a hiring agency.

NCSL_TITLE: Standard for Assessing Risk of Serious Harm
NCSL_SUMMARY: Revises the standard for a law enforcement officer to take a person into protective custody, changes that standard to the law enforcement officer's having probable cause to believe the person is mentally ill and, due to that condition, the person poses a likelihood of serious harm.

NCSL_SUMMARY: Requires certain law enforcement agencies to use body-worn cameras, requires law enforcement agencies to adopt certain policies and procedures, revokes a police officer's certification after conviction or making certain pleas, adds a cause of action for spoliation by a law enforcement officer in the tort claims act.

Provides that when a person is under arrest, or otherwise in custody of a police officer, peace officer, or other law enforcement representative or entity, such officer, representative or entity shall have a duty to provide attention to the medical and mental health needs of such person.

NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to Virginia Freedom of Information Act, relates to law-enforcement criminal incident information, relates to criminal investigative files, adds criminal investigative files, defined in the bill, relating to a criminal investigation or proceeding that is not ongoing, also defined in the bill, to the types of law-enforcement and criminal records required to be released in accordance with the provisions of the Virginia Freedom of Information Act.

NCSL_TITLE: Minimum Training Standards for Law Enforcement Officers
NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to minimum training standards for law-enforcement officers, relates to crisis intervention team training, requires all law-enforcement officers to complete crisis intervention team training as part of the compulsory minimum training standards subsequent to employment as a law-enforcement officer and as part of basic training and the recertification of law-enforcement officers.

Relates to law-enforcement officer, relates to failure to intervene in an unlawful use of force, relates to penalties, requires that any law-enforcement officer who witnesses another law-enforcement officer engaging or attempting to engage in the unlawful use of force against another person shall intervene, when such intervention is objectively reasonable and possible, to end the unlawful use or attempted unlawful use of force, or to prevent the further unlawful use of force.

Relates to decertification of law enforcement officers, requires any Sheriff, Chief of Police, or agency administrator to notify the Criminal Justice Services Board in writing within a specified number of hours of becoming aware that any certified law enforcement or jail officer currently employed by his agency has been terminated for engaging in misconduct, as set forth in the bill, requires the Board to initiate decertification proceedings against such current or former law enforcement or jail officer.

Relates to search warrants, prohibits any law enforcement officer from seeking, executing, or participating in the execution of a no knock search warrant, defined in the bill as any search warrant executed without law enforcement officers giving notice of their identity, authority, and purpose prior to entering the place to be searched, requires a law enforcement officer to provide notice of his identity, authority, and purpose.

NCSL_TITLE: Use of Force by Peace Officers
NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to modifying the standard for use of force by peace officers, provides that physical force may be used to the extent necessary, clarifying that deadly force may be used in the face of an immediate threat, clarifies that physical force may be used to protect against a criminal offense when there is probable cause that a person has committed or is committing the offense, authorizes the use of physical force to prevent a person from fleeing a temporary investigative detention.

NCSL_SUMMARY: Concerns defenses in personal injury and wrongful death actions where the person injured or killed was committing a felony, adds an exception for actions arising out of law enforcement activities to the complete defense to any action for damages for personal injury or wrongful death that the person injured or killed was engaged in the commission of a felony, provides that in such law enforcement actions, it must be proven that the person was engaged in the commission of a felony at the time of occurrence.

NCSL_SUMMARY: Relates to minimum standards for hiring of pre-certified law enforcement officers, prohibits law enforcement agencies from employing or offering to employ a pre-certified law enforcement officer without certain findings, requires a hiring law enforcement agency to make written findings or adopt the written findings of a previous employing agency documenting that the officer meets certain standards, requires such findings to be made available to the Law Enforcement Professional Standards Subcommittee.
